com.github.kaiwinter.androidremotenotifications.model

Enum UpdatePolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<UpdatePolicy>
      • com.github.kaiwinter.androidremotenotifications.model.UpdatePolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<UpdatePolicy>

    public enum UpdatePolicy
extends java.lang.Enum<UpdatePolicy>
    Defines how often the notifications are updated from the server. Doing this on each start of your app (NOW) might lead to too many server calls. You can reduce them by using WEEKLY or MONTHLY.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      BI_WEEKLY
      The update is made every second week.
      MONTHLY
      The update is made once a month.
      NOW
      The update is made now, regardless when the last one was.
      WEEKLY
      The update is made once a week.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • NOW

        public static final UpdatePolicy NOW
        The update is made now, regardless when the last one was.

      • WEEKLY

        public static final UpdatePolicy WEEKLY
        The update is made once a week. RemoteNotifications uses an internal shared preference to track when the last update was.

      • BI_WEEKLY

        public static final UpdatePolicy BI_WEEKLY
        The update is made every second week. RemoteNotifications uses an internal shared preference to track when the last update was.

      • MONTHLY

        public static final UpdatePolicy MONTHLY
        The update is made once a month. RemoteNotifications uses an internal shared preference to track when the last update was.

      • shouldUpdate

        public boolean shouldUpdate(java.util.Date lastUpdate)
        Checks if the interval of this UpdatePolicy is over in regard to the lastUpdate.
        Parameters:
        lastUpdate - The Date of the last update.
        Returns:
        true if an update should be done, else false.
